intro: Ternstroemia trilocularis, commonly known as the three-chambered ternstroemia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Theaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface. Its small, white flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom during the rainy season. The fruit is a three-chambered capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
